content.raw: I've merged this with default in a new branch in pull request #200
content.html: I've merged this with default in a new branch in pull request #200

content.raw: I've closed that branch in favor of pull request #199
content.html: I've closed that branch in favor of pull request #199

content.raw:
~~~
diff -r de2c2df3c29f include/ignition/math/config.hh.in
--- a/include/ignition/math/config.hh.in        Tue Oct 03 10:51:54 2017 -0700
+++ b/include/ignition/math/config.hh.in        Tue Oct 03 17:41:12 2017 -0700
@@ -10,6 +10,6 @@
 
 #define IGNITION_MATH_VERSION_HEADER "Ignition math, version ${PROJECT_VERSION_FULL}\nCopyright (C) 2014 Open Source Robotics Foundation.\nReleased under the Apache 2.0 License.\n\n"
 
-#cmakedefine BUILD_TYPE_PROFILE 1
-#cmakedefine BUILD_TYPE_DEBUG 1
-#cmakedefine BUILD_TYPE_RELEASE 1
+#cmakedefine IGNITION_MATH_BUILD_TYPE_PROFILE 1
+#cmakedefine IGNITION_MATH_BUILD_TYPE_DEBUG 1
+#cmakedefine IGNITION_MATH_BUILD_TYPE_RELEASE 1
~~~
content.html:
diff -r de2c2df3c29f include/ignition/math/config.hh.in
--- a/include/ignition/math/config.hh.in        Tue Oct 03 10:51:54 2017 -0700
+++ b/include/ignition/math/config.hh.in        Tue Oct 03 17:41:12 2017 -0700
@@ -10,6 +10,6 @@

 #define IGNITION_MATH_VERSION_HEADER "Ignition math, version ${PROJECT_VERSION_FULL}\nCopyright (C) 2014 Open Source Robotics Foundation.\nReleased under the Apache 2.0 License.\n\n"

-#cmakedefine BUILD_TYPE_PROFILE 1
-#cmakedefine BUILD_TYPE_DEBUG 1
-#cmakedefine BUILD_TYPE_RELEASE 1
+#cmakedefine IGNITION_MATH_BUILD_TYPE_PROFILE 1
+#cmakedefine IGNITION_MATH_BUILD_TYPE_DEBUG 1
+#cmakedefine IGNITION_MATH_BUILD_TYPE_RELEASE 1

content.raw:
while we're working on this; I think we need to make a practice of prefixing these variables, as I've seen some symbol collisions in gazebo

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2343/symbol-collision-for-build_type_-variables

How does `IGNITION_MATH_BUILD_TYPE_*` sound?
content.html:
while we're working on this; I think we need to make a practice of prefixing these variables, as I've seen some symbol collisions in gazebo

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2343/symbol-collision-for-build_type_-variables

How does IGNITION_MATH_BUILD_TYPE_* sound?

content.html: Fixed in the latest ign-cmake PR by this commit.

content.raw: It's been corrected in the `Components` branch of `ign-cmake`, but the fix hasn't trickled into the current PR. I can do a quick update to the current  PR to fix it.
content.html: It's been corrected in the Components branch of ign-cmake, but the fix hasn't trickled into the current PR. I can do a quick update to the current PR to fix it.

content.raw: Feel free to merge it into this one. The only thing not working is the coverage ;)
content.html: Feel free to merge it into this one. The only thing not working is the coverage ;)

content.raw:
I'm also +1 to targeting default, and for common to use ignition-math4

I'll make homebrew formulae for `ignition-cmake` and `ignition-math4` to make CI work for this
content.html:
I'm also +1 to targeting default, and for common to use ignition-math4

I'll make homebrew formulae for ignition-cmake and ignition-math4 to make CI work for this

content.raw:
I'll leave this PR up so it can be used as an example for people who are interested in migrating, at least until I've created a refactored version of the `default` branch.

We then might want to consider bumping `ignition-common0` to depend on `ignition-math4` instead of `ignition-math3` to minimize any friction in that dependency relationship. (It's not strictly necessary, but it will probably make things simpler for us later on.)
content.html:
I'll leave this PR up so it can be used as an example for people who are interested in migrating, at least until I've created a refactored version of the default branch.

We then might want to consider bumping ignition-common0 to depend on ignition-math4 instead of ignition-math3 to minimize any friction in that dependency relationship. (It's not strictly necessary, but it will probably make things simpler for us later on.)

content.raw: +1 for targeting default, since this could break downstream projects.
content.html: +1 for targeting default, since this could break downstream projects.

content.raw: While this pull request doesn't have any effect on the API or ABI of `ignition-math`, it does impact the build system of gazebo. Considering how broad the implications might be for this change, we may want to target a later version (perhaps even an unreleased major version) instead of `ignition-math3`.
content.html: While this pull request doesn't have any effect on the API or ABI of ignition-math, it does impact the build system of gazebo. Considering how broad the implications might be for this change, we may want to target a later version (perhaps even an unreleased major version) instead of ignition-math3.
